body:
### Describe your issue

Thinking more about the `except *` in `nogil` performance pitfall. It's kind of hard to work around when calling 3rd party code that hasn't added exception specifications (even if you know they won't really raise exceptions).

I propose a very localized `cython.call_with_legacy_noexcept(function(other_function()))` which only affects the function it directly wraps. In this example `other_function` would be called normally.

I'm
1. deliberately suggesting an ugly name
2. making it as localized as possible (i.e. not even a decorator or a with block) to try to prevent it from being the standard boiler-plate that people copy (like `boundscheck(False)` ends up being). The intention is that you have to actively choose it.

This is potentially a bit of an issue if an exception is actually raised. However, it's no worse than setting `legacy_implicit_noexcept` set in setup.py (which I think applies it to every pxd file you use irrespective of how they were originally written). It's just aimed to be a way of working around these calls as locally as possible.
title: [ENH] Add a way to disable exception checks for a single function call
